author: @aperson1181
text: fyi, dividend are always accounted in the stock price, when a company announces a dividend, the stock price goes down. The market always accounts for dividends, so no, you don't get extra % w/ dividends, you sacrificing grows vs dividers. Amazon never paid dividends, but applied towards operations aka growth. Look at the stock price of Amazon vs Johnson and Johnson (which pays dividends), which stock are you ahead with?  w dividends you get somewhat stability, w/o dividends you get growth

author: @0xbitbybit
text: I'm permanently one to two weeks away from no money, living paycheck to paycheck unable to ever get ahead, ever. Bills rock up at the right time, Christmas happens and I need to buy presents, unforseen circumstances pop up and take my money when I get paid. Getting out of this rut is the hardest thing I've ever tried to do. I wish I could be like you! You have it pretty good. It's important to never lose sight of that I think. Well done!
